dynamicRegistration.description:
Whether implementation supports dynamic registration. If this is set to `true`
the client supports the new `(TextDocumentRegistrationOptions & StaticRegistrationOptions)`
return value for the corresponding server capability as well.

codeActionLiteralSupport.description:
The client support code action literals of type `CodeAction` as a valid
response of the `textDocument/codeAction` request. If the property is not
set the request can only return `Command` literals.

codeActionKind.description:
The code action kind is support with the following value
set.

valueSet.description:
The code action kind values the client supports. When this
property exists the client also guarantees that it will
handle values outside its set gracefully and falls back
to a default value when unknown.

dataSupport.description:
Whether code action supports the `data` property which is
preserved between a `textDocument/codeAction` and a
`codeAction/resolve` request.

disabledSupport.description: Whether code action supports the `disabled` property.

dynamicRegistration.description: Whether code action supports dynamic registration.

honorsChangeAnnotations.description:
Whether th client honors the change annotations in
text edits and resource operations returned via the
`CodeAction#edit` property by for example presenting
the workspace edit in the user interface and asking
for confirmation.

isPreferredSupport.description: Whether code action supports the `isPreferred` property.

resolveSupport.description:
Whether the client support resolving additional code action
properties via a separate `codeAction/resolve` request.

properties.description: The properties that a client can resolve lazily.

dynamicRegistration.description: Whether code lens supports dynamic registration.

refreshSupport.description:
Whether the client implementation supports a refresh request sent from the
server to the client.

Note that this event is global and will force the client to refresh all
code lenses currently shown. It should be used with absolute care and is
useful for situation where a server for example detect a project wide
change that requires such a calculation.

completionItem.description:
The client supports the following `CompletionItem` specific
capabilities.

commitCharactersSupport.description: Client supports commit characters on a completion item.

deprecatedSupport.description: Client supports the deprecated property on a completion item.

documentationFormat.description:
Client supports the follow content formats for the documentation
property. The order describes the preferred format of the client.

items.description:
Describes the content type that a client supports in various
result literals like `Hover`, `ParameterInfo` or `CompletionItem`.

Please note that `MarkupKinds` must not start with a `$`. This kinds
are reserved for internal usage.

insertReplaceSupport.description:
Client support insert replace edit to control different behavior if a
completion item is inserted in the text or should replace text.

insertTextModeSupport.description:
The client supports the `insertTextMode` property on
a completion item to override the whitespace handling mode
as defined by the client (see `insertTextMode`).

items.description:
How whitespace and indentation is handled during completion
item insertion.

preselectSupport.description: Client supports the preselect property on a completion item.

resolveSupport.description:
Indicates which properties a client can resolve lazily on a completion
item. Before version 3.16.0 only the predefined properties `documentation`
and `details` could be resolved lazily.

properties.description: The properties that a client can resolve lazily.

snippetSupport.description:
Client supports snippets as insert text.

A snippet can define tab stops and placeholders with `$1`, `$2`
and `${3:foo}`. `$0` defines the final tab stop, it defaults to
the end of the snippet. Placeholders with equal identifiers are linked,
that is typing in one will update others too.

tagSupport.description:
Client supports the tag property on a completion item. Clients supporting
tags have to handle unknown tags gracefully. Clients especially need to
preserve unknown tags when sending a completion item back to the server in
a resolve call.

valueSet.description: The tags supported by the client.

The completion item kind values the client supports. When this
property exists the client also guarantees that it will
handle values outside its set gracefully and falls back
to a default value when unknown.

If this property is not present the client only supports
the completion items kinds from `Text` to `Reference` as defined in
the initial version of the protocol.

items.description: The kind of a completion entry.

contextSupport.description:
The client supports to send additional context information for a
`textDocument/completion` request.

dynamicRegistration.description: Whether completion supports dynamic registration.

insertTextMode.description:
Defines how the client handles whitespace and indentation
when accepting a completion item that uses multi line
text in either `insertText` or `textEdit`.

dynamicRegistration.description:
Whether declaration supports dynamic registration. If this is set to `true`
the client supports the new `DeclarationRegistrationOptions` return value
for the corresponding server capability as well.

linkSupport.description: The client supports additional metadata in the form of declaration links.

dynamicRegistration.description: Whether definition supports dynamic registration.

linkSupport.description: The client supports additional metadata in the form of definition links.

dynamicRegistration.description: Did change configuration notification supports dynamic registration.

Did change watched files notification supports dynamic registration. Please note
that the current protocol doesn't support static configuration for file changes
from the server side.

Whether implementation supports dynamic registration. If this is set to `true`
the client supports the new `DocumentColorRegistrationOptions` return value
for the corresponding server capability as well.
Whether formatting supports dynamic registration.
Whether document highlight supports dynamic registration.
Whether document link supports dynamic registration.

tooltipSupport.description: Whether the client support the `tooltip` property on `DocumentLink`.

dynamicRegistration.description: Whether on type formatting supports dynamic registration.
Whether range formatting supports dynamic registration.
Whether document symbol supports dynamic registration.

hierarchicalDocumentSymbolSupport.description: The client support hierarchical document symbols.

labelSupport.description:
The client supports an additional label presented in the UI when
registering a document symbol provider.

valueSet.description:
The symbol kind values the client supports. When this
property exists the client also guarantees that it will
handle values outside its set gracefully and falls back
to a default value when unknown.

If this property is not present the client only supports
the symbol kinds from `File` to `Array` as defined in
the initial version of the protocol.

tagSupport.description:
The client supports tags on `SymbolInformation`. Tags are supported on
`DocumentSymbol` if `hierarchicalDocumentSymbolSupport` is set to true.
Clients supporting tags have to handle unknown tags gracefully.

valueSet.description: The tags supported by the client.

dynamicRegistration.description: Execute command supports dynamic registration.

FileOperationClientCapabilities.description:
Capabilities relating to events from file operations by the user in the client.

These events do not come from the file system, they come from user operations
like renaming a file in the UI.

didCreate.description: The client has support for sending didCreateFiles notifications.

didDelete.description: The client has support for sending didDeleteFiles notifications.

didRename.description: The client has support for sending didRenameFiles notifications.

dynamicRegistration.description: Whether the client supports dynamic registration for file requests/notifications.

willCreate.description: The client has support for willCreateFiles requests.

willDelete.description: The client has support for willDeleteFiles requests.

willRename.description: The client has support for willRenameFiles requests.

dynamicRegistration.description:
Whether implementation supports dynamic registration for folding range providers. If this is set to `true`
the client supports the new `FoldingRangeRegistrationOptions` return value for the corresponding server
capability as well.

lineFoldingOnly.description:
If set, the client signals that it only supports folding complete lines. If set, client will
ignore specified `startCharacter` and `endCharacter` properties in a FoldingRange.

rangeLimit.description:
The maximum number of folding ranges that the client prefers to receive per document. The value serves as a
hint, servers are free to follow the limit.

markdown.description: Client capabilities specific to the client's markdown parser.

regularExpressions.description: Client capabilities specific to regular expressions.

contentFormat.description:
Client supports the follow content formats for the content
property. The order describes the preferred format of the client.

items.description:
Describes the content type that a client supports in various
result literals like `Hover`, `ParameterInfo` or `CompletionItem`.

Please note that `MarkupKinds` must not start with a `$`. This kinds
are reserved for internal usage.

dynamicRegistration.description: Whether hover supports dynamic registration.

Whether implementation supports dynamic registration. If this is set to `true`
the client supports the new `ImplementationRegistrationOptions` return value
for the corresponding server capability as well.

linkSupport.description: The client supports additional metadata in the form of definition links.

InsertTextMode.description:
How whitespace and indentation is handled during completion
item insertion.

LinkedEditingRangeClientCapabilities.description: Client capabilities for the linked editing range request.

dynamicRegistration.description:
Whether implementation supports dynamic registration. If this is set to `true`
the client supports the new `(TextDocumentRegistrationOptions & StaticRegistrationOptions)`
return value for the corresponding server capability as well.

MarkdownClientCapabilities.description: Client capabilities specific to the used markdown parser.

MonikerClientCapabilities.description: Client capabilities specific to the moniker request.

dynamicRegistration.description:
Whether moniker supports dynamic registration. If this is set to `true`
the client supports the new `MonikerRegistrationOptions` return value
for the corresponding server capability as well.

dataSupport.description:
Whether code action supports the `data` property which is
preserved between a `textDocument/publishDiagnostics` and
`textDocument/codeAction` request.

relatedInformation.description: Whether the clients accepts diagnostics with related information.

tagSupport.description:
Client supports the tag property to provide meta data about a diagnostic.
Clients supporting tags have to handle unknown tags gracefully.

valueSet.description: The tags supported by the client.

versionSupport.description:
Whether the client interprets the version property of the
`textDocument/publishDiagnostics` notification`s parameter.

dynamicRegistration.description: Whether references supports dynamic registration.

RegularExpressionsClientCapabilities.description: Client capabilities specific to regular expressions.

dynamicRegistration.description: Whether rename supports dynamic registration.

honorsChangeAnnotations.description:
Whether th client honors the change annotations in
text edits and resource operations returned via the
rename request's workspace edit by for example presenting
the workspace edit in the user interface and asking
for confirmation.

prepareSupport.description:
Client supports testing for validity of rename operations
before execution.

prepareSupportDefaultBehavior.description:
Client supports the default behavior result.

The value indicates the default behavior used by the
client.

dynamicRegistration.description:
Whether implementation supports dynamic registration for selection range providers. If this is set to `true`
the client supports the new `SelectionRangeRegistrationOptions` return value for the corresponding server
capability as well.

Whether implementation supports dynamic registration. If this is set to `true`
the client supports the new `(TextDocumentRegistrationOptions & StaticRegistrationOptions)`
return value for the corresponding server capability as well.

formats.description: The token formats the clients supports.

multilineTokenSupport.description: Whether the client supports tokens that can span multiple lines.

overlappingTokenSupport.description: Whether the client supports tokens that can overlap each other.

requests.description:
Which requests the client supports and might send to the server
depending on the server's capability. Please note that clients might not
show semantic tokens or degrade some of the user experience if a range
or full request is advertised by the client but not provided by the
server. If for example the client capability `requests.full` and
`request.range` are both set to true but the server only provides a
range provider the client might not render a minimap correctly or might
even decide to not show any semantic tokens at all.

delta.description:
The client will send the `textDocument/semanticTokens/full/delta` request if
the server provides a corresponding handler.

full.description:
The client will send the `textDocument/semanticTokens/full` request if
the server provides a corresponding handler.

range.description:
The client will send the `textDocument/semanticTokens/range` request if
the server provides a corresponding handler.

tokenModifiers.description: The token modifiers that the client supports.

tokenTypes.description: The token types that the client supports.

refreshSupport.description:
Whether the client implementation supports a refresh request sent from
the server to the client.

Note that this event is global and will force the client to refresh all
semantic tokens currently shown. It should be used with absolute care
and is useful for situation where a server for example detect a project
wide change that requires such a calculation.

ShowDocumentClientCapabilities.description: Client capabilities for the show document request.

support.description:
The client has support for the show document
request.

additionalPropertiesSupport.description:
Whether the client supports additional attributes which
are preserved and send back to the server in the
request's response.

contextSupport.description:
The client supports to send additional context information for a
`textDocument/signatureHelp` request. A client that opts into
contextSupport will also support the `retriggerCharacters` on
`SignatureHelpOptions`.

dynamicRegistration.description: Whether signature help supports dynamic registration.

signatureInformation.description:
The client supports the following `SignatureInformation`
specific properties.

activeParameterSupport.description:
The client support the `activeParameter` property on `SignatureInformation`
literal.

documentationFormat.description:
Client supports the follow content formats for the documentation
property. The order describes the preferred format of the client.

items.description:
Describes the content type that a client supports in various
result literals like `Hover`, `ParameterInfo` or `CompletionItem`.

Please note that `MarkupKinds` must not start with a `$`. This kinds
are reserved for internal usage.

parameterInformation.description: Client capabilities specific to parameter information.

labelOffsetSupport.description:
The client supports processing label offsets instead of a
simple label string.

callHierarchy.description: Capabilities specific to the various call hierarchy request.

linkedEditingRange.description: Capabilities specific to the linked editing range request.

moniker.description: Client capabilities specific to the moniker request.

semanticTokens.description: Capabilities specific to the various semantic token request.

synchronization.description: Defines which synchronization capabilities the client supports.

didSave.description: The client supports did save notifications.

dynamicRegistration.description: Whether text document synchronization supports dynamic registration.

willSave.description: The client supports sending will save notifications.

willSaveWaitUntil.description:
The client supports sending a will save request and
waits for a response providing text edits which will
be applied to the document before it is saved.

dynamicRegistration.description:
Whether implementation supports dynamic registration. If this is set to `true`
the client supports the new `TypeDefinitionRegistrationOptions` return value
for the corresponding server capability as well.

linkSupport.description:
The client supports additional metadata in the form of definition links.

Since 3.14.0

showDocument.description: Capabilities specific to the showDocument request.

showMessage.description: Capabilities specific to the showMessage request.

workDoneProgress.description:
Whether client supports handling progress notifications. If set
servers are allowed to report in `workDoneProgress` property in the
request specific server capabilities.

applyEdit.description:
The client supports applying batch edits
to the workspace by supporting the request
'workspace/applyEdit'

codeLens.description:
Capabilities specific to the code lens requests scoped to the
workspace.

fileOperations.description:
The client has support for file notifications/requests for user operations on files.

Since 3.16.0

semanticTokens.description:
Capabilities specific to the semantic token requests scoped to the
workspace.

changeAnnotationSupport.description:
Whether the client in general supports change annotations on text edits,
create file, rename file and delete file changes.

groupsOnLabel.description:
Whether the client groups edits with equal labels into tree nodes,
for instance all edits labelled with "Changes in Strings" would
be a tree node.

documentChanges.description: The client supports versioned document changes in `WorkspaceEdit`s

failureHandling.description:
The failure handling strategy of a client if applying the workspace edit
fails.

normalizesLineEndings.description:
Whether the client normalizes line endings to the client specific
setting.
If set to `true` the client will normalize line ending characters
in a workspace edit containing to the client specific new line
character.

resourceOperations.description:
The resource operations the client supports. Clients should at least
support 'create', 'rename' and 'delete' files and folders.

items.description: The kind of resource operations supported by the client.

dynamicRegistration.description: Symbol request supports dynamic registration.

symbolKind.description: Specific capabilities for the `SymbolKind` in the `workspace/symbol` request.

valueSet.description:
The symbol kind values the client supports. When this
property exists the client also guarantees that it will
handle values outside its set gracefully and falls back
to a default value when unknown.

If this property is not present the client only supports
the symbol kinds from `File` to `Array` as defined in
the initial version of the protocol.

tagSupport.description:
The client supports tags on `SymbolInformation`.
Clients supporting tags have to handle unknown tags gracefully.

valueSet.description: The tags supported by the client.

uinteger.description: Defines an unsigned integer in the range of 0 to 2^31 - 1.

description: Defines the capabilities provided by the client.
